body.head.byline: By Michael Cooper (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg appoints Frederick A O Schwarz Jr chairman of city's Campaign Finance Board; photo (S)

block.p: Frederick A. O. Schwarz Jr., left, was appointed chairman of the city's Campaign Finance Board yesterday by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg. The board distributes public matching funds to candidates who qualify, publishes voter guides to each election, and oversees a candidate debate program. Mr. Schwarz is a lawyer who was the city's corporation counsel during the Koch administration and chairman of the 1989 charter commission that reshaped city government. A great-grandson of the founder of the Fifth Avenue toy store F. A. O. Schwarz, he will succeed the Rev. Joseph A. O'Hare, who was the first chairman of the finance board.
